intro: Mesembryanthemum noctiflorum subsp. stramineum, commonly known as the nightflower mesem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces striking, star-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptations to arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit makes it an interesting subject for both ecological study and ornamental gardening.
